applications.name: Microsoft Excel
applications.description: Microsoft Excel is a spreadsheet application used for data organization, calculation, analysis, and visualization through formulas, charts, and pivot tables.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and O together to open the file browser dialog where you can select an Excel workbook to open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce the dialog and file list. Use arrow keys to navigate files and Enter to open.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and S together to save the current workbook. Opens Save As dialog for new workbooks.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce save confirmation or present Save As dialog for unsaved workbooks.

shortcuts.description: Press F12 to open the Save As dialog where you can choose location and filename for your workbook.
shortcuts.notes: Focus moves to filename field. Screen readers announce dialog and current filename if applicable.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open the print dialog where you can configure printer settings and print worksheets.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print preview and settings. Tab through options to configure printing.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and N together to create a new blank workbook in a new window.
shortcuts.notes: Focus moves to cell A1 of new workbook. Screen readers announce new workbook creation.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and W together to close the current workbook. Prompts to save if there are unsaved changes.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will announce any save prompt before closing workbook.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then F to open the File backstage view for accessing file operations like save, open, and options.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce backstage view. Use arrow keys to navigate menu options.

shortcuts.context: When cell is selected or text is selected in formula bar
shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to make cell content bold or remove bold if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce bold formatting depending on verbosity settings when reading cell content.

shortcuts.context: When cell is selected or text is selected in formula bar
shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to make cell content italic or remove italic if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce italic formatting when reading cell attributes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to underline cell content or remove underline if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce underline formatting based on user verbosity preferences.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 5 together to apply or remove strikethrough formatting on cell content.
shortcuts.notes: Most screen readers do not automatically announce strikethrough. Use cell formatting commands to verify.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and 1 together to open the Format Cells dialog where you can set number format, alignment, font, and borders.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog and current tab. Use Ctrl+Tab to switch between tabs within dialog.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Tilde together to apply the general number format to selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce format changes. Verify by reading cell value.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Dollar Sign together to apply currency format with two decimal places to selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read formatted value with currency symbol when navigating to cell.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Percent together to apply percentage format with no decimal places to selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read cell value as percentage when navigating.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Caret together to apply scientific notation format with two decimal places.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read value in scientific notation format like 1 point 23 E plus 04.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Hash together to apply date format showing day, month, and year.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read formatted date value when cell is selected.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and At Sign together to apply time format showing hours and minutes with AM or PM.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read formatted time value when navigating to cell.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Ampersand together to apply an outline border around selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce border formatting. Visual change only.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Underscore together to remove all borders from selected cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce border removal. Visual formatting only.

shortcuts.description: Press Up Arrow to move the active cell selection one row up in the worksheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell address and content when moving between cells.

shortcuts.description: Press Down Arrow to move the active cell selection one row down in the worksheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell address and content as you navigate downward.

shortcuts.description: Press Left Arrow to move the active cell selection one column to the left.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell reference and content when moving left.

shortcuts.description: Press Right Arrow to move the active cell selection one column to the right.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell address and content as you move right through columns.

shortcuts.action: Move to edge of data region right
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Right Arrow together to jump to the last filled cell in the current row before an empty cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce destination cell. Very useful for navigating large datasets quickly.

shortcuts.action: Move to edge of data region left
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Left Arrow together to jump to the first filled cell in the current row before an empty cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce destination cell address and content.

shortcuts.action: Move to edge of data region down
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Down Arrow together to jump to the last filled cell in the current column before an empty cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce destination cell. Efficient for navigating to end of data columns.

shortcuts.action: Move to edge of data region up
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Up Arrow together to jump to the first filled cell in the current column before an empty cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce destination cell address and content.

shortcuts.description: Press Home to move to column A of the current row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell A and the row number along with cell content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Home together to move to cell A1, the top-left cell of the worksheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell A1 and its content. Quick way to return to worksheet start.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and End together to move to the last cell in the used range of the worksheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce the last used cell address and content. Defines worksheet data boundaries.

shortcuts.description: Press Page Down to move the active cell down by one visible screen of rows.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell position. Number of rows depends on screen size and zoom level.

shortcuts.description: Press Page Up to move the active cell up by one visible screen of rows.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell location after moving up one screen.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Page Down together to move the active cell right by one visible screen of columns.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell address after horizontal screen movement.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Page Up together to move the active cell left by one visible screen of columns.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce destination cell after moving left one screen.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and G together to open the Go To dialog where you can navigate to a specific cell reference or named range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog. Type cell address like B12 or range name and press Enter to navigate.

shortcuts.description: Press F5 to open the Go To dialog for navigating to specific cells, ranges, or special cell types.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce the Go To dialog. Use Special button to access Go To Special options.

shortcuts.context: When in workbook with multiple sheets
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Page Down together to move to the next worksheet tab in the workbook.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce the new sheet name and active cell on that sheet.

shortcuts.context: When in workbook with multiple sheets
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Page Up together to move to the previous worksheet tab in the workbook.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous sheet name and current cell location.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select the current data region or entire worksheet depending on cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selected range dimensions like 100 rows by 10 columns selected.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection by one cell right
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Right Arrow together to extend the selection one cell to the right.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cells being added to selection as range expands.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection by one cell left
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Left Arrow together to extend the selection one cell to the left.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cells added to selection as you extend leftward.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection by one cell down
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Down Arrow together to extend the selection one cell downward.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce additional cells as selection grows downward.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection by one cell up
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Up Arrow together to extend the selection one cell upward.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cells being added as selection extends upward.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to last used cell
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and End together to extend selection from active cell to the last used cell in worksheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce the selection range dimensions after extending.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Home together to extend selection from active cell to cell A1.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selection range after extending to worksheet start.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to edge of data right
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Right Arrow together to extend selection to the last filled cell in the row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selection extension to edge of data region.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to edge of data left
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Left Arrow together to extend selection to the first filled cell in the row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selection spanning to data region boundary.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to edge of data down
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Down Arrow together to extend selection to the last filled cell in the column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selection extending to bottom of data column.

shortcuts.action: Extend selection to edge of data up
shortcuts.context: When cell is selected in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Up Arrow together to extend selection to the first filled cell in the column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selection extending to top of data column.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Spacebar together to select the entire column containing the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce entire column selected with column letter.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Spacebar together to select the entire row containing the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce entire row selected with row number.

shortcuts.context: When cell is in data region
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Asterisk together to select the current region around the active cell bounded by empty rows and columns.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce the selected range dimensions. Useful for selecting tables.

shortcuts.description: Press F2 to enter edit mode for the active cell, allowing you to modify its content directly in the cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce edit mode and read cell content. Cursor is placed at end of cell text.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to cancel editing and restore the original cell content before changes.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce edit cancelled and read original cell value.

shortcuts.action: Complete cell entry and move down
shortcuts.description: Press Enter to complete the cell entry and move the active cell down one row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new cell address and content after entering data.

shortcuts.action: Complete cell entry and move up
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Enter together to complete the cell entry and move the active cell up one row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell above and its content after data entry.

shortcuts.action: Complete cell entry and move right
shortcuts.description: Press Tab to complete the cell entry and move the active cell one column to the right.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next cell to the right and its content.

shortcuts.action: Complete cell entry and move left
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to complete the cell entry and move the active cell one column to the left.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell to the left and its content after entry.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected cells and place them on clipboard for pasting elsewhere.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce content cut to clipboard. Selected cells show moving border.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected cells to clipboard without removing them.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce content copied. Copied cells display moving border indicator.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content starting at the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce paste occurred. Navigate to pasted cells to hear content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and V together to open Paste Special dialog for selective pasting options.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog. Use arrow keys to select paste type like values, formulas, or formats.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo the last action or edit performed.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce what action was undone depending on verbosity.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to redo the last action that was undone.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo action completion.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Delete to clear the contents of selected cells without removing formatting or comments.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cells cleared. Cell formatting and structure remain intact.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Minus together to open Delete dialog where you can choose to delete cells and shift surrounding cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog options. Choose to shift cells left, up, or delete entire rows or columns.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Plus together to open Insert dialog for inserting new cells, rows, or columns.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog. Select whether to shift cells right, down, or insert entire rows or columns.

shortcuts.context: When range of cells is selected vertically
shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to fill the selected range with content from the topmost cell in the selection.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fill completion. Navigate through filled cells to verify content.

shortcuts.context: When range of cells is selected horizontally
shortcuts.description: Press Control and R together to fill the selected range with content from the leftmost cell in the selection.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fill operation. Check filled cells by navigating right.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open the Find dialog for searching cell content in the worksheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Find dialog and place focus in search field. Results navigate to matching cells.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open Find and Replace dialog for searching and replacing cell content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog. Tab between Find and Replace fields to enter search and replacement text.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H then E then F to clear all formatting from selected cells while keeping content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not typically announce formatting removal. Content remains unchanged.

shortcuts.description: Press Equals sign to begin entering a formula in the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce formula mode. As you type, Excel may suggest functions.

shortcuts.context: When entering or editing a formula
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F3 together to open the Insert Function dialog for searching and inserting Excel functions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog. Type function name or browse categories with Tab and arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press F9 to manually recalculate all formulas in all open workbooks.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically do not announce calculation completion. Navigate to cells to hear updated values.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F9 together to recalculate formulas only in the active worksheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers do not announce recalculation. Check formula results by navigating to cells.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Grave Accent together to toggle between displaying formula results and formula text in cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read formulas as text when formula view is active instead of results.

shortcuts.context: When cell is selected below or beside data
shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Equals together to automatically insert a SUM function for adjacent cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce the inserted SUM formula with cell range. Press Enter to confirm.

shortcuts.context: When cell or range is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and F3 together to open Name Manager where you can create, edit, or delete named ranges.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Name Manager dialog. Tab to create new name or edit existing names.

shortcuts.context: When range with headers is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and F3 together to create named ranges automatically using row or column headers.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog. Choose whether to use top row, left column, or other edges as names.

shortcuts.description: Press F3 to open Paste Name dialog showing all named ranges you can insert into the current formula.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog with list of defined names. Select name and press Enter to insert.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Enter together to complete an array formula that performs multiple calculations.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read formula with curly braces indicating array formula when reviewing cell.

shortcuts.context: When cell is in data range
shortcuts.description: Press Control and T together to create an Excel table from the selected range with automatic filtering and formatting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce table creation. Table provides structured navigation with filter buttons in header row.

shortcuts.context: When cell is in data range
shortcuts.description: Press Control and L together to create an Excel table from selected data, same function as Ctrl+T.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce table dialog. Verify if data has headers before confirming.

shortcuts.context: When cell is in data range
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and L together to turn autofilter on or off for the current data range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce filter buttons added to header row. Use Alt+Down Arrow to open filter menus.

shortcuts.context: When cell with filter button is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Down Arrow together when in header cell to open the filter dropdown menu.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce filter menu. Use arrow keys to navigate filter options and spacebar to check items.

shortcuts.context: When cell is in data column
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then A then S then A to sort the data in ascending order based on the selected column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce sort completion. Navigate cells to verify sort order.

shortcuts.context: When cell is in data column
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then A then S then D to sort the data in descending order based on the selected column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce descending sort applied. Check data order by navigating cells.

shortcuts.context: When rows or columns are selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and Right Arrow together to group selected rows or columns with collapsible outline.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce grouping created. Use Alt+Shift+Left Arrow to ungroup.

shortcuts.context: When grouped rows or columns are selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and Left Arrow together to remove grouping from selected rows or columns.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce ungrouping. Outline controls are removed from worksheet.

shortcuts.context: When cell is below data column
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and Equals together to insert AutoSum for the data directly above the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce SUM formula inserted. Formula includes range above until blank cell or header.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Semicolon together to insert the current date as a static value in the active cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read the inserted date value when cell is selected or during entry.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Semicolon together to insert the current time as a static value.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers will read the inserted time value in the active cell.

shortcuts.description: Press F11 to create a chart on a new sheet using the default chart type for the selected data.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new chart sheet created. Chart elements may not be fully accessible without additional navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and F1 together to create an embedded chart on the current worksheet using selected data.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce chart object inserted. Navigate to chart using Tab or arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F11 together to insert a new blank worksheet before the active sheet.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new sheet created and sheet name. Focus moves to new sheet.

shortcuts.context: When chart or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and 1 together when object is selected to open formatting dialog for that object.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce format dialog for selected chart element or object.

shortcuts.context: When cell is in data range
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N then V to open the Create PivotTable dialog for summarizing data.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce PivotTable dialog. Choose data range and destination for new PivotTable.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and Right Arrow together to group selected items in a PivotTable field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce group creation. Grouped items appear under single header.

shortcuts.context: When grouped PivotTable items are selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and Left Arrow together to ungroup items in a PivotTable field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce ungrouping. Items return to individual entries.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F2 together to insert a new comment or edit an existing comment in the selected cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment entry mode. Focus moves to comment text area for typing.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and F2 together to insert a new threaded comment that supports replies and collaboration.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment pane opening. Type comment text and press Post to add.

shortcuts.context: When cell with comment is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F10 then D to open context menu and delete the comment in the selected cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce context menu. D key activates delete comment command.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then Q to open the Zoom dialog where you can set worksheet magnification level.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce zoom dialog. Type percentage or select preset zoom level.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then I to switch to Page Break Preview mode for adjusting print page boundaries.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce view change to Page Break Preview.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then L to return to Normal view for standard worksheet editing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce return to Normal view.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then P to switch to Page Layout view showing headers, footers, and page margins.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Page Layout view activated.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then F then F to freeze rows above and columns left of the selected cell.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce freeze panes activated. Frozen areas remain visible when scrolling.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W then S to split the window into resizable panes at the active cell position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce window split. Each pane can scroll independently.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 9 together to hide the selected rows from view without deleting them.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce rows hidden. Row numbers will skip hidden rows when navigating.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 0 together to hide the selected columns from view without deleting them.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce columns hidden. Column letters will skip hidden columns.

shortcuts.context: When rows surrounding hidden rows are selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 9 together to unhide rows within the selected range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce rows unhidden. Previously hidden rows become visible and accessible.

shortcuts.context: When columns surrounding hidden columns are selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 0 together to unhide columns within the selected range.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce columns unhidden. Hidden columns reappear in worksheet.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then R then A then C to open Accessibility Checker pane showing accessibility issues in the workbook.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce pane with list of issues. Tab through to review and fix each accessibility problem.

shortcuts.context: When cell or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F10 together to open the context menu for the selected cell or object.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce context menu opening. Use arrow keys to navigate menu options.

shortcuts.context: When object or chart is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Alt then J then P then P then A to open Alt Text pane for adding descriptions to objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Alt Text pane. Focus moves to description field for entering alternative text.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Grave Accent together with some screen readers to hear detailed cell information.
shortcuts.notes: Specific to certain screen reader configurations. May announce cell reference, value, formula, and formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt to display key tip badges showing letters to press for accessing ribbon tabs and commands.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce key tips activated. Press displayed letters to navigate ribbon commands.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then H to activate the Home tab ribbon with formatting and editing commands.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Home tab active. Continue with additional keys for specific commands.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then N to activate the Insert tab for adding tables, charts, and other objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Insert tab. Use additional key sequences for insertion commands.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then A to activate the Data tab with sorting, filtering, and data tools.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Data tab activated.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then M to activate the Formulas tab for function library and formula auditing tools.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Formulas tab active.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then R to activate the Review tab with comments, protection, and accessibility checking.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Review tab activated.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then W to activate the View tab for controlling worksheet views, zoom, and window options.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce View tab active.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Tab together to move forward through tabs in dialogs like Format Cells.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce each tab name as you move through dialog tabs.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Tab together to move backward through tabs in dialogs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous tab name when navigating backwards.
